alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Grady; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 11:13AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Grady, southern Oklahoma, northwestern Cleveland and northwestern McClain Counties through 1145 AM CDT... At 1113 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northeast of Newcastle to 4 miles east of Amber. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, western Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Newcastle, Choctaw, Tuttle, Spencer, Jones, Nicoma Park, Valley Brook, Bridge Creek, Tinker Air Force Base, Forest Park, Lake Aluma, Smith Village, The Capitol, The Fairgrounds and Will Rogers Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 111 and 133. Interstate 40 between mile markers 146 and 161. Interstate 44 between mile markers 90 and 121. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
